body:
### Problem

Calling `expand()` with a long pattern (seemingly larger than `MAXPATHL` bytes) with `wildignorecase` set crashes Nvim.

_Thanks to @kevinburke for reporting and helping me reproduce this!_ üôè

`free(): invalid next size (normal)(99999))` is printed (possibly heap corruption?)

Increasing the size of [this `xmalloc`](https://github.com/neovim/neovim/blob/f1422a313fa57c8c7045163aa209a9fd9166fe5a/src/nvim/path.c#L630) seems to mitigate the issue; I don't have more time today to investigate this further, though.

Backtrace:
```
#0  0x00007f8eadd1f114 in __pthread_kill_implementation () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#1  0x00007f8eadcc5f9e in raise () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#2  0x00007f8eadcad942 in abort () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#3  0x00007f8eadcae7a7 in __libc_message_impl.cold () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#4  0x00007f8eadd292a5 in malloc_printerr () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#5  0x00007f8eadd2b44c in _int_free_merge_chunk () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#6  0x00007f8eadd2e00e in free () from /lib64/libc.so.6
#7  0x00000000005fbfda in xfree (ptr=0x10198aa0) at neovim/src/nvim/memory.c:144
#8  0x0000000000660d2c in do_path_expand (gap=0x7ffd5d362970, path=0x102654d0 'a' <repeats 200 times>..., wildoff=0, flags=295, didstar=false) at neovim/src/nvim/path.c:780
#9  0x00000000006603e8 in path_expand (gap=0x7ffd5d362970, path=0x102654d0 'a' <repeats 200 times>..., flags=295) at neovim/src/nvim/path.c:590
#10 0x000000000066227a in gen_expand_wildcards (num_pat=1, pat=0x7ffd5d362a28, num_file=0x7ffd5d362d50, file=0x7ffd5d362d68, flags=295) at neovim/src/nvim/path.c:1326
#11 0x0000000000663c67 in expand_wildcards (num_pat=1, pat=0x7ffd5d362a28, num_files=0x7ffd5d362d50, files=0x7ffd5d362d68, flags=295) at neovim/src/nvim/path.c:2154
#12 0x0000000000663ba4 in expand_wildcards_eval (pat=0x7ffd5d362a80, num_file=0x7ffd5d362d50, file=0x7ffd5d362d68, flags=295) at neovim/src/nvim/path.c:2117
#13 0x000000000047b1e3 in expand_files_and_dirs (xp=0x7ffd5d362d00, pat=0x102654d0 'a' <repeats 200 times>..., matches=0x7ffd5d362d68, numMatches=0x7ffd5d362d50, flags=295, options=325)
    at neovim/src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:2527
#14 0x000000000047b7aa in ExpandFromContext (xp=0x7ffd5d362d00, pat=0x102654d0 'a' <repeats 200 times>..., matches=0x7ffd5d362d68, numMatches=0x7ffd5d362d50, options=325)
    at neovim/src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:2735
#15 0x0000000000477a01 in ExpandOne_start (mode=6, xp=0x7ffd5d362d00, str=0x102654d0 'a' <repeats 200 times>..., options=325) at neovim/src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:736
#16 0x0000000000477e97 in ExpandOne (xp=0x7ffd5d362d00, str=0x102654d0 'a' <repeats 200 times>..., orig=0x0, options=325, mode=6) at neovim/src/nvim/cmdexpand.c:908
#17 0x00000000004dfe72 in f_expand (argvars=0x7ffd5d363160, rettv=0x7ffd5d363310, fptr=...) at neovim/src/nvim/eval/funcs.c:1706
#18 0x00000000004dc320 in call_internal_func (fname=0x1018ee50 "expand", argcount=1, argvars=0x7ffd5d363160, rettv=0x7ffd5d363310) at neovim/src/nvim/eval/funcs.c:288
#19 0x00000000004ffc21 in call_func (funcname=0x10185350 "expand", len=6, rettv=0x7ffd5d363310, argcount_in=1, argvars_in=0x7ffd5d363160, funcexe=0x7ffd5d363320)
    at neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:1779
#20 0x00000000004fcded in get_func_tv (name=0x10185350 "expand", len=-1, rettv=0x7ffd5d363310, arg=0x7ffd5d3633a8, evalarg=0x7ffd5d3633f0, funcexe=0x7ffd5d363320)
    at neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:585
#21 0x000000000050420a in ex_call_inner (eap=0x7ffd5d363550, name=0x10185350 "expand", arg=0x7ffd5d3633a8, startarg=0x1022e09c "('a'->repeat(99999))", funcexe_init=0x7ffd5d363410, evalarg=0x7ffd5d3633f0)
    at neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:3324
#22 0x0000000000504bf7 in ex_call (eap=0x7ffd5d363550) at neovim/src/nvim/eval/userfunc.c:3566
#23 0x0000000000523a3d in execute_cmd0 (retv=0x7ffd5d363508, eap=0x7ffd5d363550, errormsg=0x7ffd5d363520, preview=false) at neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:1714
#24 0x0000000000525858 in do_one_cmd (cmdlinep=0x7ffd5d363770, flags=0, cstack=0x7ffd5d363880, fgetline=0x53db2c <getexline>, cookie=0x0) at neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:2358
#25 0x000000000052152b in do_cmdline (cmdline=0x0, fgetline=0x53db2c <getexline>, cookie=0x0, flags=0) at neovim/src/nvim/ex_docmd.c:669
#26 0x00000000006224b1 in nv_colon (cap=0x7ffd5d363ef0) at neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:3189
#27 0x000000000061e10e in normal_execute (state=0x7ffd5d363e80, key=58) at neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:1244
#28 0x00000000006f72a5 in state_enter (s=0x7ffd5d363e80) at neovim/src/nvim/state.c:102
#29 0x000000000061c307 in normal_enter (cmdwin=false, noexmode=false) at neovim/src/nvim/normal.c:523
#30 0x00000000005c2055 in main (argc=3, argv=0x7ffd5d364288) at neovim/src/nvim/main.c:651
```

### Steps to reproduce

```vim
set wildignorecase
call expand('a'->repeat(99999))
```

### Expected behavior

No crash.

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.11.0-dev-1941+g903242f160

### Vim (not Nvim) behaves the same?

Seems unaffected? Couldn't repro with v9.1.1202

### Operating system/version

Fedora Workstation 41 (Linux 6.13.5)

### Terminal name/version

tmux 3.5a (in ghostty 1.1.3 efc1b10bfdaa4ea990cfd34c4a031c0c267c48ed)

### $TERM environment variable

tmux-256color

### Installation

Source

labels.description: issue is fixed in vim and patch needs to be ported
labels.name: has:vim-patch

labels.description: issue reporting a crash or segfault
labels.name: bug-crash

title: `expand()` crash with long pattern and `wildignorecase`
